text: According to the 2016 Australian Census, 4,872 Mexicans lived in Australia. Mexicans are concentrated in New South Wales with the population of 1,703 followed by Victoria (1,478), Queensland (761) and Western Australia (359). The first Mexican person recorded in Australia was a male living in Tasmania in 1881.Mexican Culture - Mexicans in Australia ==References== Category:Mexican diaspora Category:Australian people
title: Mexican Australians
